page.title: 18HALF MARATHON
page.content: On June the 6th,1985,took place one of the few-perhaps the only-organised sporting events in the area,the Carnforth half marathon,taking in Capernwray and Borwick on a two lap course.The roads and footpaths in this area are fine for running:quiet,a splendid variety of views,but never fast or easy.The roads are nowhere flat,the hills are mostly short and stiff,with none of the protection from the elements enjoyed by the urban runner.But the changing vistas make all efforts worth while-the lakes, Ingleborough and the Keer valley. The canal is for easier days:flat,almost bucolic,shared greetings with boaters,anglers and dog walkers:the snag is the dog dirt.The race by the way was won in 70 minutes:fairly good on these roads.
